name: OSKAR Model
description: The OSKAR Model is a solution-focused coaching approach that emphasizes outcomes, scaling, knowledge, action, and review. It is especially useful in workplace and performance coaching.

desired_outcome.title: What do you want to achieve?

success_indicators.title: What will be different when you succeed?
success_indicators.description: Identify what will change when the outcome is achieved

current_scale_position.title: On a scale of 1-10, where are you now?
current_scale_position.description: Rate current position on a scale towards the desired outcome

scale_reasoning.title: What makes it that score and not lower?
scale_reasoning.description: Explore what's already working that prevents a lower score

existing_strengths.title: What strengths and resources do you already have?
existing_strengths.description: Identify current strengths and available resources

past_successes.title: What has worked well before?
past_successes.description: Reflect on previous successful approaches and strategies

forward_steps.title: What steps will you take to move forward?
forward_steps.description: Define specific steps to progress towards the outcome

support_needed.title: What support do you need?
support_needed.description: Identify what support or resources are needed

progress_made.title: What progress have you made?
progress_made.description: Review and acknowledge progress made so far

next_actions.title: What will you do next to continue momentum?
next_actions.description: Plan next actions to maintain and build momentum
